column2: rating
column3: comment

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I love this app so much, I have Spotify premium and the benefits are great. All the features are great. But the app itself could use some work, certain glitches or errors in certain features effect the listeners experience in a negative way. For example, the jam feature, where 2 or more people can listen from different devices at the same time, it's a great feature. It's a great way to feel connected through music. But whenever you add a song, or the host adds a song, the song glitches

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Love the app, great features. One seriously aggravating problem: if I don't turn on shuffle, I don't want it on shuffle. I don't think it should be assumed that people want something mixed or a single played song. That's how my Spotify opens every time and it's terrible. Other than that, it's a phenomenal app and I would still recommend it to people.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is my main music app, and my most preferred, it gives me good suggestions and aligns with my mood quite well. it's a great music app overall, with amazing UI, nice features, and the most accurate Radios I've experienced through all the music apps I've tried. Aside from the features locked to premium, the lyrics are not a premium feature and doesn't even attempt to load the lyrics any further once it doesn't the first time. and it's annoying since it works when it wants to work.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I use it for both music and podcasts and either way I hate the way the queue works. Or actually doesn't work . It took me ages to find the tab for it, which I stumbled in accidentally. And the way it so easily drops downloads! And I can't figure out why if I try to play an album it switches back to a podcast after one song! The solution was to clear my podcast queue. NO!!!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Love Spotify, and have for years. HOWEVER... my only beef is that while the app WILL technically run in the background, if the app is not front-and-center screen, it will randomly cut out and stop. I use my phone for Uber navigation, so Spotify cannot be the diva on screen, so it will constantly throw a hissy fit and stop if this is the case. Very annoying to have to constantly fiddle with my phone to re-open the app window and restart my music. Other than that, Spotify is the best music app!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I love Spotify. I use it almost every day and I have the premium account which I enjoy. But, I have been having issues with the podcasts. When I click my headphone button to resume where I left off, it hardly works. I go into the app, and like some reviews have said I get a black screen, and timestamp is sometimes 0:00 and the play button is unresponsive. I have to force quit the app. Very, very annoying. Also, the shuffle button for music SUCKS. May as well be called the "reorganize" button.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify and paying premium for about eight years now. The experience, however, only worsens. The app is bloated and sluggish on mobile. I have to fight device selection, smart shuffle and background requests to features I have no interest in like videos, lyrics and band info. This used to be a solid music player. Now it is an app that tries to do a dozen other things by compromising on the main functionality. I'm organizing myself to move away from this bloated mess.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Do not use this app for podcasts. It does all the standard stuff you'd want for music, plain and dry, but its podcast features are an absolute mess. More headache than its worth, especially with much better alternatives on the market. The podcasts on here break the app literally every time it's used, and the only fix is to force stop the app. Every time. Any time. If you pause the app once, because you had to do something quick, expect another force shut down. Simply don't get this for podcasts

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify used to be great. So great that I got the premium. With recent updates, the UI changed drastically, in my oppinion for the better. New features that were really cool and useful for people who liked to expand their tastes. But now, the app doesn't work half the time. It freezes constantly and lags so bad that I'm here writing this review to tell Spotify this: FIX THIS ASAP.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using Spotify Premium for almost "4 Years" that a very long time,I can say that, It was one of the best and my favourite music application. On the other hand they also added podcast but I never liked listening podcast in Spotify .But from last one year, I started experiencing bugs, lags ,crashes and also some unwanted recommendations, which is ruining my experience. And as they are trying to add more and more features ,user interface getting complicated and ruining user experience.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: The app works well for the most part. The shuffle feature(s) tend to be repetitive depending on the song one starts with. Also, since the last patch,the app doesn't sync with my vehicles Bluetooth: always "there is no song info available" where before there had never been a problem. It's also bugging out on my phone and displaying incorrect information when I play anything: wrong song titles, artists etc.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The new widget is far too large and can't be shrunk. The 4Ã—1 widget was perfect. Making the smallest one a 3Ã—2 (which can be widened to 4Ã—2) means it doesn't fit in my typical layout. It takes up more space and offers the same amount of controls. It's frankly moronic. Fix this absolute nonsense and bring back the 4Ã—1 or at least let us shrink it back.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Latest update made it impossible to listen to podcasts while driving. It no longer pauses the podcast while the Google maps navigation voice talks. So I miss part of the show and have to rewind 15 seconds. I talked to support and they just said "that's a new feature." And "switch to using Waze" I'm very disappointed and may have to cancel my premium plan if this isn't fixed. Basically made it worthless for me as I listito podcasts while driving.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I completely stopped using Spotify after they decided to remove basic features (like playing just the songs in a playlist) inorder to make their premium offering more attractive. That is not how you encourage someone to try out your subscription. It's digital extortion at its worst. And Guess what, it's been about 6 months since I stopped using it and the world hasn't come to an end. Well what do you know!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I feel like the app is pushing sparkly functions but not very helpful ones. I'd like my car view back to easily skip or pause songs with a huge button, for example. You can make it optional for people who drive a car with fancy media function. Or fix shuffle. Or show saved playlists on the first screen vs in a tab you need to look for. Those kinda things. Thanks!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Pretty good and has compatibility with tons of other tools and apps just by virtue of popularity. Though theres some of quality of life issues I wish would get addressed, and it feels like each UI update has something mildly annoying to add. For instance I wish it didn't take 3 button presses to simply unlike a song. It would be nice to be able to pin folders within folders, and not automatically shuffle or loop albums saved in folders.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Something has happened where auto play, even though it's on, does not work. If I search a song and click on it, after it ends it either doesn't play anything or replays the same song over and over. Repeat button is not highlighted. It has been doing this for the last month or so. I have an android phone. I don't want to delete and reinstall the app because I have ove 300 songs downloaded.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Can't listen to a whole album without it changing to a song from a completely different album. Have to pay for basic feature like shuffle/playing songs in order or skipping more than 5-6 time a day. Can barely play podcasts anymore, WHICH WAS THE MAIN REASON I GOT IT. What makes this worse is that youtube has all these "features". You can skip, easily make a playlist of anything, and PICK THE ORDER OF SONGS YOU WANT TO LISTEN TO. How is it better than the app specifically made for music?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: As a music streaming app, the streaming part is just bad. Even with a stable internet connection, my music is intermittent... its infuriating. More so, it seems to always think that the app is set to offline when it is not. The app worked fine before... what have you devs done to screw it up? Changed from 2 to 1 star. Now it won't even play downloaded songs properly.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I'd been using an older version of the app for months because it worked perfectly. It let me pick as many songs as I wanted, skip as many times as I wanted, and it ran smoothly. The other day, I wanted to change my profile photo and the button to change it just.. disappeared? And no matter what I did it wouldn't show up so I had no other option but to update to the latest version and honestly, I could've done with not changing my picture. Limited everything, trash interface, and much slower.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is getting desperate. Why are basic features, like playing a song you want to listen to or even just rewinding a song, to be paid for? It's become more of a money grab than a music app. It was all tolerable till a little long ago; only things that were premium were ads and ofcourse offline music. But now, we only have "6 skips an hour", and I can't even tell if I'm listening to music with ads or the otherway round. Please work things out to the consumers and owner's convenience.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It would be cool if the shuffle feature actually shuffled. It doesn't matter what song I start it on, if I hit "shuffle" it plays the same songs, in the same order, every time. Kind of defeats the whole purpose of the shuffle. I already had issues with this app not feeling super user friendly and this just makes it worse. I may go back to my old streaming service because it just ruins the experience for me.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Since an update a few months ago it's been so slow and unresponsive. When I want to keep listening to music that I was listening to earlier, if I try to continue playing it, it'll just lag and then just disappear so I then have to go back into my playlist and click shuffle again, and keep spamming the button until it actually starts playing. This never happened before, it would just start playing music where I left off, no matter how long it had been idle. There's other problems too I'm sick of

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify keeps stopping music play (even though I pay for premium). Mid-song, it will just stop playing music and I have to pause the song and resume it again to continue listening until the bug hits again. This has been happening frequently the past month or so. I've tried uninstalling the app and reinstalling it twice now, but the bug eventually comes back inevitably. This NEEDS to get fixed or I'm switching to Apple Music.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: That DJ AI is perfect with only odd, going off, if something doesn't take your interest, it's bound to put something on that might do. Flows too. I find Spotify is missing categories, so it's impossible to find stuff from a certain category if not in the related section. Which in turn, could help undiscovered artists or new ones set up their stands. The music quality is pretty good and the app runs well. I've had a bug when a track is on repeat. The skip function breaks down on the player.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Music is good. The shifting "shelves" of topics constantly changing is annoying. Wanted to listen to some new albums in the "New albums for you" section, the section disappeared after only selecting one. Display all the types of shelves and let the user customize their position in settings and it would be better. Update 3/14/24 When I select "shuffle", I want to shuffle my whole Playlist, or an artists whole discography, not the 12 song I've listened to the most, and not their top 5 songs.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This app has made it difficult for me to play musice that I like. I can't skip foward and rewind music to my liking, just click on any song I want, and I can't seem to handle the ads. Spotify should let the free users have the same premium features without paying for it. Also, they're taking out half the songs that were on there, now I can't listen to half the things I like. Their feedbacks are the same everytime and they won't change anything. Please change things. I don't want to pay for music

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Vastly inferior to the desktop version of the app. Some features from desktop are locked behind a Premium subscription on the mobile version, such as basic functionality like playing an album (sometimes it just plays suggested similar songs instead of songs from the album you pressed play on). Also, I have frequent issues where playlists just unexpectedly stop after a few songs, which doesn't make me want to subscribe.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Really unhappy with how treats online/offline. If I've got a downloaded playlist and my wi-fi isn't connected, in online mode it will stop between songs. Works fine in offline mode. If I'm in offline mode and I pick an online feature (eg DJ) it just spins. I can't even get to settings or the back button. I gave to stop the app. So I'm constantly going back and forth between online and offline modes, which takes a lot of strokes and scrolls. Also don't like how it handles podcasts.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: If you don't have Spotify Premium its horrible use Youtube instead. If you do have Premium, then its a great app to listen music to and has many options, lots of great quality of life features and integrations with your devices that it is nice to just quickly pop open whenever (or instantly continue what you were listening to before if you don't fully close the app) and listen to your favorite songs. Although you really have to get Premium for it to be any good.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Playlists will play the same 30 odd songs. Artists that have clearly paid the most money to appear on everyone's feed show up consistently while scrolling through main feed. Spotify "Jam" feature does not work at all, any time a person pauses and restarts a song it glitches and will pause playback immediately after pressing play button. AI DJ is a feature with much potential but plays the same 30 odd songs, as well as a few new ones. Overall quality has plummeted.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I've tried a few other music services and this android app is now probably the best of the bunch as far as stability. However, the music service is near the bottom. Worst of the bunch maybe. It's all due to the forced "made for you" feature. It just ends up playing the same handful of songs no matter where you go, it seems. The algorithms most likely just limits the royalties Spotify has to pay to artists while limiting the variety of songs and the possibility of discovering new music.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Having the same issues as Maxwell W. (below): "... l'm having a very difficult time getting the app to consistently and reliably play podcasts. Oftentimes when I go to play an episode it just loads a black Ui, the play button is unresponsive, with a timestamp reading of 0:00. I have to restart my entire phone in order to get it to finally play ..."

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Good app but after the new update the control panel on mobile during background play freezes constantly, and no longer lets you go back or forward on your audio using the slider. This is on the premium version. Hope it gets fixed soon. Offline features are also not working as well as they were. Why update if youre just going to make everything worse???

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: App has gone downhill in the past few updates. Adding new songs to playlists is difficult and tends to cause the app to freeze up and crash. It is very difficult to navigate to different songs or playlists due to the app lagging. The offline feature doesn't work anymore and music I have downloaded can't be played. This was never an issue in the past.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It was good, but now it won't work. At all. Last time it kicked me out my account after months so I made a new one, it was good for a while now it won't let me play ANYTHING, and I have playlists, but Spotify got rid of that play? button so now I can't play any songs. But I 'can add songs onto my playlists' but spotify won't even show me the songs that are on there already. Nothing works anymore and I can't use it. It keeps saying that playing a song is a premium feature when obviously it isnt..

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has steadily declined over the last ~2.5 years. The worst is their AI shuffle, which overplays your favorite songs until you hate them or only ever plays the same 10 songs that you heard the first time you shuffled a playlist. This can't be turned off. Songs will randomly pause and claim they're still playing. The "download music" feature almost never works when I actually don't have service and need it. Every time I open the app, it says I don't have internet and spazzes out. Use Apple.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Hate the free Spotify but it's the only thing I have as I'm too poor for premium currently (I'm being serious too), and the ads SUCK. Can't even get the "targeted ads" or whatever right, I keep getting ads of things I hate and whenever I click the dislike button (or whatever it's called) it just gives me the ad more... Like thanks for the ad of stuff I hate instead of things relevant to me and don't make me want to uninstall the app for a different music app! (heavy sarcasm)

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The app is usually brilliant. Recently it has started to play up. The player will randomly pause whatever you're listening to, while still displaying a "pause" button, indicating that the player believes is it playing. You have to pause, then play again. In the grand scheme of things it's not a huge issue, but can be very annoying when working with both hands. Device is a Pixel 5.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I hate the new update. The removal of the like button has made everything worse from sorting out songs to figuring out which ones I like or haven't listened to yet, and now I don't know. I was enjoying Spotify on my Chromebook because it had the like button, and made everything easier to sort and quick to see what songs I already listened to \ liked. Now I have to click every, single, song to see if I listened to it or not. Also, be nicer to non-premium users

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is total garbage for listening to podcasts. You can't access premium subscriptions of podcasts; it will show an episode that you're in the middle of on your home screen, but when you click on it, it doesn't take you to that episode. There's no option on the app for an entire list of just songs of an artist- you have to go in and out of albums; sometimes an album won't even be listed on an artist's page - you have to search for it directly. That's just a FEW issues & SUPER glitchy lately.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Auto plays randomly with a BT connected. This has been a long-standing issue. I'll be on a phone call and when the call disconnects Spotify automatically plays. Even though I was not using the app. There's a bunch of proposed fixes online but none of them work. I switched to Amazon music years ago because of this. *** Update***I will not contact customer support. Problem is plastered all over the Spotify community page. Generic response is laughable. Either fix it or own it! Amazon MUSIC FTW!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Good but not great app. Issues: Navigation confusing. Hitting back button doesn't bring you to album you're listening to as it should. When you use menu to go to album it doesn't have current song highlighted, which is idiotic. Hitting back button can unexpectedly exit app. I have it set to continue playing music after album or playlist is finished but it never does so. Daily Mix never updates.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Recently have started having issues with the music player widget on the lock screen and notification panel - Galaxy S21 Ultra on One UI 6.0. Sometimes does not update the current track that's playing, sometimes it does update the track that's playing, but the track time/scrubber is missing. Also not showing track information when using Bluetooth audio on car stereo, and is causing issues on Android Auto where there is no track information displayed or play/pause/skip buttons. Can you please fix.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Pros: Huge library. Cons: New features are overly intrusive. No high definition audio. Getting expensive. Everything else is car (Android Auto) related... Difficult to navigate relative to the app. Subscribed podcasts never show in home, only library, and you cannot go to your library without opening the full app (in car mode). Auto plays when connected to a device (there used to be a way to turn this off?). When it does autoplay it's often not what you were last listening too.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: App recently broke in March 2024. I updated the app since liked songs from smart shuffle enabled doesn't add the song to the "liked songs" default list. The + button would never change to a heart and the song would never populate in playlist. After updating today, pressing shuffle button a couple times does not enable smart shuffle anymore. Only regular shuffle is available and I'm premium sub. App is super unstable and inconsistent now. Disappointing and inconvenient. Lost a lot of songs.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Not sure who signed off on the new interface but the homepage is useless now. One BIG card for each playlist covering the entire screen removes the usability of the homepage completely. It's hard to read, the user gains zero additional information about the playlist. Im not scrolling TikTok I'm trying to find music to listen to. I have no reason to see the canvas of a song before I even open the playlist. Information density is no more. The old one was at least useable.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Until recently the app worked great, I use it offline to listen to music as I don't have much data, but recently randomly a lot of songs are unable to download even though I previously had them downloaded. I have tried everything I can think of and looked for solutions online including on your support pages but I couldn't find much there to help at all with the issue.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using Spotify regularly since 2017. I have 300 Playlists. Unfortunately, spotify fascistically decided that every user must use their new feature 'smart shuffle' which constantly turns on by default for every playlist every time you reopen the app, and takes 5 full seconds of loading to turn off. Every. Single. Time. you open a playlist. I have never used this feature. I never will use this feature. Spotify provides no way to turn it off permanently. I will be canceling membership.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: These developers do not care. And why does it consistently want to play music I skip consistently? Just because I "liked" it doesn't mean I want it on heavy rotation! I said it before, and I'll say it again: this app need a feature similar to what Pandora has where they "put it on the shelf for a while." When will spotify fix its algorithms and stop shuffling the same 1 or 2 hrs of music in a playlist that I skip when the said playlist is 11 hrs long? Fix this issue!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Recently upgraded from an s9 to an a54. It as though spotify thinks my phone got 15 years older with how bad the app runs on a brand new phone. App takes a few minutes to load anything besides a black screen then takes an unacceptable amount of time to load playlists, skip songs, change settings, you name it. If thus remains unfixed I'll switch services.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: My premium just got expired, and I notice it just now that how messed-up they have made this app for non-premium users. The most basic and important feature 'Autoplay' is totally totally nonsense with forced spotify recommendations in a personal playlist, I mean playing the advertisements is not enough for you that you make people listen the songs they don't want to! Never buying Spotify Premium until you fix some important things for the free users :)

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It's been really slow lately to the point I can't even use it because the front page won't load Update: I did reinstalled the app and the same problem persists, when I open the initial page will be just the loading icon and nothing more, I can't access my Playlist from the landing page and any other feature takes so long to load that I even close the app. Thinking about canceling my plan

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Update for Android really needs to be reviewed before publishing.If I put my music to shuffle, shuffle. If I put my music to not shuffle, don't shuffle.Remove those buttons if it's not going to work the correct way. It's really annoying that I have to close the app and reopen it every so often because it completely stops when I tell it to shuffle and not to shuffle or it decides to just stay on smart shuffle. I DONT WANT TO SMART SHUFFLE. Also, the widget size.Why change it? Spot premium btw

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app autoplays songs when connected to any Bluetooth device like car. Will start autoplaying repeatedly despite stopping the music. It doesn't even have a feature to stop autoplaying. We will have to disconnect from Bluetooth device if we don't want to listen to music. And there's no feedback option in the app so that the problem can be updated to the app creators.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: You *have* to pay for Premium in order to use the app. Can't skip songs and can't listen to them in order, among other things, which should be basic features considering you have ads playing in between your songs. Jam is a great addition but it's sloppy, constantly pauses while listening long-distance. Mostly sticking to it because of convenience but it could improve in a lot of ways. Some things were overdone over the years, which is a shame.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Look, I like Spotify. Maybe the sound quality could be better, and maybe it would be nice if they had a more robust catalog- but it serves it's purpose, especially with Premium. However, I reached out to support regarding an issue with the offline download feature because my playlists were not being fully downloaded. I was jerked around by three different agents and told to make a new account, and then told I'll have to pay premium again just to see if this solved my problem. Ridiculous.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: The music sounds good, creating your list is easy. My only gripe is that when I drive, I out it in my phone holder and it doesn't rotate to landscape mode, also, if I get a phone call, when I answer, I lose my navigation. The map turns off and the phone app stays on. Only happens with this app. Pandora used to let me keep nab on top. So If I don't know where im going, I can't answer my phone otherwise I can't see where I'm going. Wish they would fix these two things. Waiting on an update

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Plays whatever Spotify want to on the FREE version, they try to bully you effectively into paying for a subscription now by repeatedly playing the same advert again and again without variation and by throwing in music they think you may (or probably don't) want to hear. The FREE versions of the app gives you a good idea of the company and where things are going, Spotify used to be great, but first adverts, then removed features, only premium. +i don't think it's value for money comparatively.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: A disaster update Please bring back the color edit option for the Instagram story section. In the new update, you can only choose 3 background colors, all of which are awful. You are regressing over time, not progressing. You have already removed the letters in the left-hand or right-hand section. Now the color. Please return it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Why am I paying for something that doesn't work? Out of nowhere, the app started having problems and re-installing doesn't fix it. I used to be able to control the app from my phone's preview/lock screen, now I have to unlock my phone and go into the app to do it and even then it still freezes sometimes. It also doesn't interface with my car correctly anymore. Just a blank or frozen screen, defeating the purpose of car screen/mode. And I know it's not my device since all other apps work fine

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: HATE the new update. My shortcut is permanently frozen so i cant control the app in the background. Hide song feature broken. Very annoying & inconvenient. Will use other apps til fixed. & i miss the previous algorithm. When I would select a song it would play songs specifically from that same time period or genre; now no matter what I play it shuffles the same 20 songs :/ pls bring back the old method. Doesn't make sense why I am playing a song from 1992 and the next one that plays is from 2023

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I like listening to music on it but only when it let's me. The desktop and tablet version of Spotify is pretty good because it actually lets me play the songs I want to. The mobile app, however, is basic garbage since it never plays the songs I want it to. I have to click the same song several times just to here the actually song because other random songs are playing instead. This never happens on the desktop or mobile version. Literally why can't I just hear the song I wanted to hear???

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify's new features are making it worse. I can't even play my favorite song more than once; to replay it, it's asking for a premium membership or requiring me to wait until tomorrow. Also, the repeat shuffle mode is off. Now, add more features to make it even more unbearable, ensuring it can no longer be used for free without premium.Alternatives options are there to use rather than to use this useless app.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: After the update recently the tab on my notification bar won't update to the song current that's playing nor let me scroll forward or back on the song. More importantly, I am no longer able to pause or skip songs through my lockscreen. The little pop up thats usually there has completely disappeared. I've tried everything but nothing works

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I unequivocally do not want smart shuffle to EVER be on. Tell me why nearly every time I switch between my playlists it has been turned back on???? It is not wanted! The option to add similar songs to a playlist is great but you have RUINED the shuffle button. It is an absolute pain to deal with. Just let me have a regular shuffle button and you can add an extra button or setting to do your annoying smart shuffle nonsense. I'm BEGGING you to let me permanently disable it.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Please bring the timer feature when you're connected to a different device (ex: Chromecast, Google devices as speaker.) Also lyrics on the same day a song drops. Please add a "thumbs down" feature. Especially to build a better DJ. The AI needs a lot of fixing. Repeat should NOT be a default feature that's on either.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Earlier it was a good music app but now it's becoming worse - previous button, skip to any part, repeat song option and play in any order all these features are in premium now. Like seriously ðŸ™„ ðŸ˜’ WHYðŸ˜¡ . Basically all the features are going in premium. Not even lyrics are present. And now you can't even listen to your own playlist peacefully. You will be interrupted by songs or music which are not in your playlist

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm lowering my rating of Spotify unfortunately as the recent rounds of updates are making it harder and harder to efficiently use and find new music. The bottomless scroll approach probably serves spotify's goals better than the users. My daily mix playlists used to appear on the home screen, but now they are buried three menu layers down in favor of the bottomless scroll. I would love to see them come back and give me the ability to disable the endless scroll.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Yes, too many times and too often. The new features instead of being something that enhance the app from the others are becoming a useless annoyance and detrimental for the efficiency of the app, turn back and make it stable, the rest dj, ai, divination and so on are b.s. Efficiency first, then what ever you want but if it make it unusable TURNBACK.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I HATE THE SMART SHUFFLE. Please take it off or at least have a button so we can disable it! It turns itself on!!! I have a playlist I NEVER turn on shuffle for and the app always turns on smart shuffle in the middle of it! Or if I turn off regular shuffle, then turn off smart shuffle so it plays the next song, it'll turn the smart shuffle back on after 1 or 2 songs. I'm so mad. It pisses me off. Take it away!!!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: After getting tired of sitting through 5 ads every two songs, I decided to try one of the premium free trials. Problem is that as soon as my account was given premium abilities, it was essentially non functional. Editing playlists is a nightmare, with the app crashing if you try to add more than 3 songs to a playlist in a row. With spotify its either excessive ads without basic features or pay $10/month for a nonfunctional app.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Mostly does what I want. Nice multi device features, usually works well, though occasional issues with syncing and queue state. Good quality sound. Some frustrations with the UI like limited multi selection support and the institute to go to previous song. But it's clear the service is being maintained and improvements are rolled out occasionally.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I enjoy the app for the most part. But recently, they have added different channels to my to my home page that will just start playing. I don't want to listen to their trash music, and I do not like the fact I can not delete this off of my stuff, and it just starts playing after podcast or my music stops.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Has become unusable! I download files because I'm often in areas without signal. However, I'm quite often finding menus won't open & files start won't playing unless you are online. Then you give it an online connection & it says "No internet connection" at the bottom. Well, every other app is managing just fine! I've repeatedly closed & reopened the app, turned my phone off & on, wiped the cache, uninstalled & reinstalled. Nothing fixes the problem for long. Unsubscribed & uninstalled!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: for one of the top streaming apps, youd think that it would be better. the app CONSTANTLY plays ads when during the ads it says "30 mins of ad free music" but the premium page says 15? and when it does play an ad, the ad always pauses and its so incredibly difficult to get to play music because during that time the ad is paused no music plays. and with all the money spotify makes, youd think that you could get premium treats for free. plus, most of the time jo music in looking for has it. 2/5â˜…s.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I like the algorithms and a search. Gigantic music library in my pocket. But there are tonnes of problems and issues with the app. Everything everywhere, i do not like the odrer of tabs, functions, and buttons. Unfortunately, the small player and player window actually does not have a swipe gesture, which allows me to open and close the player with SWIPE, not with touch.. Audio quality. Spotify does have a really big library, but the sound quality is very disappointing. 320 kbps in 2024, really?

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using spotify for many years now and, while I do love it, if there's one thing that I think needs some work, it's the shuffle feature. I have almost a thousand songs at any given time in my "liked songs" and if I shuffle it should be a lot more random, but a lot of times I hear the same handful of songs over and over. I have to hunt for ones that I haven't heard in a long time and play them, only for it to switch back to playing the ones I hear frequently when that one finishes.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using Spotify for almost a year and don't get me wrong it's a great app but I have something to say. I have Spotify on my tablet and on a phone. When I use Spotify on my tablet It works fine. It allows me to pick any song I want, play an ad, and lets me listen. ON THE PHONE THOUGH- I pick a song, sometimes it might play an ad, BUT.IT.NEVER.PLAYS.THE.SONG.I.REQUESTED! I try listening to the song as a single song or whatever, AND IT STILL DOESN'T PLAY THE SONG I WANT. Pls fix thisðŸ˜­

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Premium member here. The core of the app is great. Love that there's a feature that allows you to transition songs earlier. Love the community features like blend, jams, seeing what your friends are listening to, year in review, etc. Overall they've come a long way. But as far as spotflify generated Playlists, pandora is still very much superior. Pandora generates based on vibe. Spotify generates based on genre and popularity. And the app regressions are too often and bad to just ignore.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Ive never had problems with spotify, it was always consistent when it came to literally just playing music. NOW, it takes 1-3 seconds to play a song after tapping it, which might not seem like much but over time it adds up to the point where its a nuisance. Its a great app, always been my go-to, but if a simple thing such as playing music starts lagging behind, its not acceptable

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I couldn't listen to downloaded music when on a 5 hour airplane ride today while I was in airplane mode with no way of resolving this issue. I restarted the phone, force stopped the app, etc and nothing worked. Unacceptable for a pay for service. FIX THIS BUG!! What is the point of downloading music for offline use if the app won't even play downloaded songs? Kept saying "currently in offline mode" but wouldn't play anything.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: My phone was doing the thing everyone else, it was taking forever to load into the app and playlists. If I pressed the play button on a playlist the button would unpaid but never play music and when music did play it stopped every 5 seconds. Something I have an issue with is if I play a playlist of my episodes after 1 or 2 of them, it plays those random horrible songs out of nowhere. Sometimes the app says it's offline when it really isn't. A tip for ads is too close the app and open it again.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Improve how the Queue List functions please. E.g.: 1. New placement of "Recently Played" tab isn't convenient when dragging songs into queue list. 2. I can't go back to prev song without losing my list. Queue history would be nice. 3. An option to "play next" in addition to "add to queue" would be great! Thanks.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Doesn't open on Google watch 2. Also just doesn't play music half the time Edit: they FINALLY added a button to directly add a song to liked songs. Y'all are like a quarter of the way there, now just add hi fi Edit again: cancelling my Spotify, switching to tidal. Spotify software used to be better but now since that's taken a downfall, I'm switching over solely for hifi. Plus it's cheaper too! :)

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Was good for the first year that I've actually been using it, but over time they have gotten so greedy and removed so many features from people who don't wanna pay for premium(three or four adds before playing 4 songs, removing shuffle and regular play) its practically impossible to enjoy the app without paying for premium now. I suggest to find another app that actually allows you to listen to the songs you want when you want.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: PLEASE GIVE US THE OPTION TO PERMANENTLY TURN OFF SMART SHUFFLE!!!! It's EXTREMELY annoying when I'm trying to listen to my playlist and smart shuffle keeps turning on ON IT'S OWN!!! You have to fix this, a lot of people DON'T like the smart shuffle feature, please give an option to disable it for us!! I want to be fair, I LOVE Spotify but I need this to get noticed. column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

God awful and I don't even have the option to disable it. I don't understand why you think you have to suggest the garbage that you put in your algorithms and instead just let me have my music my way. Seriously considering switching to a different music app. Find myself aggravated more and more using this app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I'm very much considering switching to another app for my music and shows because the major inconsistencies do not warrant using it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: You guys need to stop forcing podcasts to everyone. Please add function to toggle, this shouldn't be too hard to implement. I can't be the only one annoyed by this. *Adding option to show only music, is great. Now do it without screwing with the app layout. Unbelievable how you guys manage screw this up. *App keeps pushing concerts even while notifications are off. Stop force-feeding us this sh*te.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Just fix the damn algorithms, make it same as 5 years ago when this app helped discover great music

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Keeps screen active and there's no discernible way to disable this 'feature'. I only want Spotify for music, so I want my device screen to switch off when I'm not using it. Right now though I can put the device down after selecting some music to play, them come back half an hour later to find the screen on and battery drained. Annoying!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: March 2024 update broke my download queue. I have premium and using Android. As far as I know, my download queue was working until just a couple of days ago, where if I were on a cellular data connection and had the setting in data saver to only download on wifi connection, selecting the download check mark would initiate a pending download, circling icon. Now, all that happens when I push that button is the pop-up asking me to go to settings and enable cellar data to download not on wifi.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

And now their newest problem is that the playlists I create stop after one or two songs. User interface is now terrible. I don't need all the reminders about what I've listened to. I will listen to one podcast one time and now it's on the top.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: before ,I liked the fact that after searching for some music, it offered me similar music, now when I'm looking for something, it keeps repeating the same thing until I turn off the function myself. 2. before,No matter what music I left and what genre, when I was restarting the application, it was continuing from the same one, and now it serves me completely different things automatically when I log in again, and also the daily offers are almost all the same, it is not comfortable at all..

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm really frustrated with this app. Whenever I connect my device to a bluetooth speaker, the app automatically starts playing random music, despite the fact that the autoplay feature has been turned off. I prefer to decide what to listen to and not rely on an algorithm to decide for me.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Ads even with premium account. Premium family account does not give full premium access to family members with audiobooks. No ability to customize home page. Way too expensive for what is given. Good selection of content at least.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Can't believe I'm paying for premium to be told how to listen to music...

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Always making """"Improvements"""", huh? Is that why you decided to make shuffle play a premium feature? What's next? Only premium users can make their own playlists? Removing the ability to skip at all for free users? You guys seem to forget that the radio also has ads, and we used to put up with that no problem. By going out of your way to deliberately mess with free users, you're on the path to becoming *worse* than radio. Make premium something actually worth getting.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

This is regardless of the method used to skip the song || Keep getting the green loading circle and unable to load anything, making it a waste of money if I can't even use the app to play music || Pressing the done button to add songs to a playlist is very hit & miss, stop adding rubbish features & get the basics right

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: The display shows a different song from the song that I'm listening, it happens on my phone and my car multimedia display, I find this problems so annoying, cause you have to open the app to know what the song that recently play on the app (If you use "Play simillar songs" features). I hope spotify could fix this problem quickly.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The enhanced shuffle feature is horribly implemented. There should be a simple way to reshuffle your playlist without activating enhanced shuffle, such as on the iPad app where you can hold down the shuffle button to view all shuffle options and select one. The primary bug is that if you shuffle a playlist which you have set to download for offline play, and enhanced shuffle becomes activated, it immediately tries to download all the enhanced-shuffle-added songs onto your device. This is a bug.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'd give 0 stars if I could. Deeply annoying app, considering the very poor playlist algorithms that play (at best) the same 100-200 songs despite being able to pull from a list of almost 2000 liked songs. Other annoying "features" include songs getting randomly removed from my Liked playlist, and the fact Spotify criminally underpays artists.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It used to be a good music streaming platform but with recent update I'm really very disappointed. Ads were never a problem for me and I understand they also need to make money. Edit: Just great... now I can't even play songs of my choice. It will play some random song. Had been using it even after some limitations that were put previously but not anymore.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

I have to wait so long, at least a minute to load into the main menu, or any other tab, where as if I just put the thing into offline mode it'll be faster! I would do that, but turning it in and off everytime is unreasonable! Dice

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify doesn't seem to understand a very simple thing, and that is when you try to force users to buy a subscription, it has the exact opposite effect, it makes people want to go out of their way to find other alternatives, 1. this app won't let you play the songs you want to(on phone) 2. when it says "watch an ad for 30 minutes ad free" it will be ad free for 1 or 2 if your lucky 3, oh, and it auto puts songs into your playlists. Welp new "premium feature" is turning shuffle off

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

It's a good app but it's unfortunate that it demands such processing power that it slows down terribly on a low-end Android phone.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

This is especially annoying as the scrolling feature can sometimes be very slow. Randomly Spotify also likes to jump to the beginning of the track.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

I'm maybe one more bad change away from going back to downloading my own MP3 files again because at least that's an inconvenience I can control.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: App is fine overall even if I use the free version. However the ads are starting to really bother me. I've used the app for a while, and they were fine before but now I usually get two ads in a row every two songs. Even when the app offers 30 minutes ad-free, I get the usual amount of ads. It's really annoying.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a pretty good app to be honest. the free version isn't as bad as people say it is, and obviously some features aren't available as the developers have to make a living. I've tried tidal, musi but they aren't as user friendly and as interactive as Spotify is. The audio quality is also good enough for me to enjoy music. However, the ads come up more often (1-2 times every fifteen minutes) than Spotify says it would (1 per hour).

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: Music for any mood is one of the best features on the app. The UI is clean, simple and easy to navigate. New Music alerts from my favourite artists is a feature I love as well. The app has been great so far but I don't like the fact that a song or playlist will be cached and after a couple of plays (<20), it stops automatically. I'd have to put on my WiFi or mobile data to continue listening even on Premium.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I don't know why Spotify is the dominant streaming app. It is awful. Bad interface, bad song recommendations, bad shuffling, bad queue management. The list goes on. I hear the same 6 songs no matter what starting song I choose. I can't remove songs from the queue it generates. Just awful.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Look, the service Spotify provides is great. But the fact is that the interface of the app changes fairly often. The intention is of course to improve the user experience, but that is exactly why I can't comprehend that I now have to dig through 3 layers of menu settings to access the equalizer. Spotify is an audio service where 99% of the content is either music or podcasts, if I have to dig through 3 layers of settings to acces the equalizer everytime, that is just plain out tiring....

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I don't know whether you read this or not!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

On every other device except your phone, you can rewind songs, skip forth and back and there is very little ads. However on a phone, you cannot skip songs like on other devices and there is an ad every 2 songs. I use Spotify on a laptop and on a tablet so I'm loving it there but it's useless on a phone. The app is good and all but I really despise this difference it makes when using a phone.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

Yes, some of us actually use this feature, and it sucks we can't depend on it to work.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Edit: It constantly closes, crashes while running, freezes, wont pause or play when you push the buttons and video is spotty. I updated it and problems still persist.
