Consistently closes or wont pause, then the pause/play button and marker line at the bottom stays on the screen until i touch around it. Just little things that shouldn't be an issue.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: This last update is trash. It looked and worked fine! You don't have to fix something that's already working. The search category looks and feels all cluttery. I liked how I could search from songs, albums, playlists, etc, without all those suggestions. It's feels like Google or Youtube. If I wanted that I would go there! Spotify used to be clean and straightforward. Unnacceptable and seriously considering moving on from Spotify. Please make changes and keep your users.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I like spotify and I will continue to use its premium version, but this app is horrible and it just keeps getting worse. With every new feature, you try it out, find out it sucks, and decide not to use it again, but it still hinders you! If I could use an earlier version of this app, I would, because every update makes it worse!! Ever just a setting to turn off the new features they keep on pushing would be great! But it'll never happen because they don't care. It is so frustrating.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Disappointed by the recent updates. I have a Premium subscription, I downloaded lots of albums but I couldn't use them in offline mode. Other thing that really annoys me is that everytime I'm opening the app, the downloaded stuff is gone, and i have to download them again to keep them in the main page.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Recently podcasts (audio drama- Wolf 359) have started going on shuffle without me being able to toggle it on or off... I'm not sure why I would ever want my audio drama shuffled, but the app keeps skipping ahead by 10 or 20 episodes and giving me major spoilers! This is unacceptable, honestly. Please get to the bottom of this, thank you. Other than that the app is great And I've thoroughly enjoyed my premium subscription for the better part of a decade, if not longer.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been a loyal Spotify premium user for years. I LOVE Spotify. Smart Shuffle is the worst "feature" that has ever been added. There is no way to permanently turn it off, and it is incredibly frustrating for multiple reasons. Yes you can turn it off temporarily, but it always comes back on on its own. I will be looking for an alternative music app, which is unfortunate as Spotify WAS the best.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This app used to be good, it's slowed right down lately upon opening the app, I have to close and open at least twice to get it going. The new shuffle feature is naff, turns itself on, it has to think before turning itself off, nor does it actually introduce me to new songs! You've increased your charges and delivered a slower service, not cool. Bring back the Spotify that used to be great please!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: They keep adding "features" that make the app worse. Smart Shuffle should not be part of the shuffle toggle. It takes a long time to load on long playlists, and it often turns itself back on after I toggle past it. Additionally, they are making it harder and harder to keep your playlists in a custom order. Finally, Liked Songs is now treated like a normal playlist, making it tedious to like songs and to check which songs I've liked. It's all small stuff, yes, but it adds up.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: App has become unstable af. Barely loads half the time, it's just music ffs. And it's become so bloated with all of the extra stuff, podcasts, audiobooks etc. With no options to turn that media off. No customization of your home screen, it's all what they want you to see. It's impossible to find what you want easily. The shuffle is fake, you'll hear the same 20 songs from your playlist of 10000. The app from 5 years ago was miles better than what it is now.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Another update, and still the Repeat feature is a horrible mess of a function. Not only does it turn on everytime i open the app. It still turns on automatically when it connects to any Bluetooth device. And a new bug is that it can sometimes load an old playlist when connecting to a Bluetooth device. Great job. Researching this topic, it seems to be an ongoing "feature" as far back as 2020... Oh yea the "Shuffle/ Random" function is horrible and creates the same playlists basd on one song.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I was always a Spotify fan and still kinda am if it would load! When it does load I'm lucky if I can get a couple songs in before it crashes. If the stability of the app was fixed id give it a 5. I like the new layout. With the info about artists, the scrolling lyrics and stuff. I had an older version for years and it never crashed. Even though I like the new stuff I'd gladly go back to the old version because it's all about the music!!!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Not bad at all. I use it a lot. I have some issues with it, but who doesn't with any app? 100% recommend over Pandora or iHeartRadio Edit: dropped it down to 3 stars because of two problems. One, podcasts don't pause. They made a recent update, I'm assuming, that causes the podcasts to play even though I hit the pause button. The only way to stop it is play music and pause, or close the app. Two, the AI DJ loops songs I've already heard or plays music that's different than what I listen to.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I LOVE Spotify, but there's certain features that bother me to no end. First, the shuffle feature. Doesn't exist. Spotify's shuffle chooses from your most listened to songs. Second, the "videos" that play with each artist should have an option to be turned off in settings. I'm in driving mode 24/7 just to avoid this. Other than that, I can live with everything else. I LOVE Spotify, don't get me wrong, but these features drive me absolutely nuts. Please fix them when you can.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Overall good experience, but I preferred it when we were able to add a song to a playlist as many times as we wanted. I like having whatever my current favorite song is in multiple sections, so it's guaranteed to come up more often, but now we're restricted to adding a song into a playlist once. I hate it. It's one of the reasons I moved from YouTube and then Amazon Music, and now Spotify is doing it, too.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The content and music all meet my needs, as does the layout of the app. However, I have a major issue with the app in that it turns itself on and starts blaring everytime my phone connects to a BT device. I do not have the app open or running it the background. I have disabled all of that and any auto start option. Yet, still everytime I hop in the car or put on my headphones, its blaring some random song. And the kicker is the app isnt even open, I have to go open it just to stop the music.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This app has gone down the drain. No seek feature, no play by order, nothing. Oh and why does Spotify feel the need to shove Hindi songs down my ears when I have removed it from my preference? I don't even listen to Hindi songs, and there are 6 languages in my preference. But still, Hindi, over and over and over again.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The app overall is good. But there are a few problems with it. If you can't listen to your songs for unlimited time or skips or even with proper order, you can't use the app, in other words, the app becomes useless. Even for basic functions you have to pay, no other option. Secondly, if I search for a song, hundreds of songs appear. Which one do I choose? - yeah, let's choose any - oh wait, some are not original and are copied. Other than the nice features, this app needs improvement.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Literally the only thing I want to do is shuffle songs, and it won't. IT plays the most recently added songs in the order I added them, no matter what I do. I've restarted the app, restarted my phone, deleted and re downloaded the app, I'm sitting here clearing out the queue song by song and they just pop right back up again. Shuffling songs is the most basic feature of a music app, absolutely ridiculous. I have had nothing but problems since I started using Spoify. I'm going back to YT music.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Love Spotify and subscribe to the premium plan. But the new updates removing the like button and replacing with a plus sign are so annoying I actually consider finding an alternative. It became hard to remove songs from the liked (and other playlists). The idea is nice, you can track a song in different playlists. But the execution isn't as nice.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is going the same way as other apps who don't listen to customers. I updated to find my playlists have now been totally jumbled with new songs added. In addition. When I select play recommended music, it plays the same few songs repeatedly, despite having amased huge playlists, some with several thousand songs. The design team must be a bunch of amateurs. It was bad enough when the Soundrop feature was removed, but it just goes from bad to worse. Seriously. Considering. An. Alternative.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Please bring back the Enhance feature! Using Enhance, I could build massive playlists starting with only a few songs. It was amazing for music discovery, one of the main reasons I use Spotify. There was absolutely no reason to remove that entirely unobtrusive feature, and nothing else Spotify offers is comparable. I could easily see which songs were suggested and quickly add the ones I liked. Giving a kid candy and then taking it away is just mean. I've had premium for years. How disappointing.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Stability has been lacking for a few months now, semi-frequent crashes have plagued my listening experience. Sometimes I can listen for hour with no issues, other times I can't even put my phone down before it crashes. Shuffle automatically turns itself on even with automix and similar features disabled, I constantly have to turn it back off. I also still love the part where in offline mode I still have to go online every few hours to remind the app that I still have premium.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Dear Spotify, Please, for the love of all that is good, stop forcing through updates that break half of the useful features in the app. The app is practically unusable after the April 5 update, and I specifically had auto updates turned off for this reason. Yet, somehow an update still goes through and breaks half of what I used the app for (quite literally, half). I've used this service for years; it's phenomenal, groundbreaking technology that revolutionized the way we listen to music.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I really liked this app but for some reason the mini player for Samsung no longer works. It doesn't show what's currently playing, isn't always possible to pause, can no longer rewind or skip or go back without opening the app and doing things manually, where it's still very glitchy. Doesn't seem compatible with Google Maps anymore. App keeps glitching and crashing. Some of the best features previously now missing. Was easy to navigate but now I feel like I'm stumbling in the dark. Really sad.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The new layout sucks. Can't find or get to any playlists that are made for me, you scroll down and it starts playing music from playlists that you don't want to listen to. They used to have it to where when you play a song, and that song ends, they play similar songs or artists.. now it just keeps playing the same song over and over. Spotify used to be great, even though they hardly pay anything to the artists for streams, but they've gone downhill. Time to use Apple music now.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Constantly crashing and takes far too long to load music and functions. I've done what's recommended, soft and hard resets, amongst all the other advice given to me by spotify's FAQ section,but still, every time I open it's at least 3 or 4 minutes before I can access my library (even downloaded music and local files) and then could be another 2-3 minutes just for a song to begin to play! This has been a problem for a few months, every update that's come since has done nothing to fix these bugs.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I can't remember a time when this app didn't have at least one issue. Incredibly unreliable. Each update fixes something but breaks something else. Currently, I can't open the app without it crashing. Even going to my settings to force stop the app doesn't fix it. I hate that spotify has better music quality and a more intuitive layout than YouTube music. If only the rest of the app could FUNCTION. Spotify, you literally have one job. A music app that works. FIX THIS!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I love this app, I really do, as I've been using it for years...but lately the app isn't working like it used to. It will not let me add anymore songs, (I have less than 2000 and there's supposed to be unlimited), to any playlist. Everyday I have to search for songs and podcasts I tried saving to a list. I pay for premium and I can't even listen to downloaded music offline which is a feature of premium service. It won't even download. Please fix these issues, because reinstalling doesn't help.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The single star is for a solid library of music choice, including an incredible selection of video game music. This app lacks basic features it's astonishing it's an industry leader. No voice search? When my wife searches a song and plays it, it plays that song only on repeat. When I search it, it starts a Playlist of similar music. Why is it inconsistent? It sometimes sees my galaxy fold as a tablet and won't allow car mode, other times it's fine. Did I mention NO VOICE SEARCH?! Ridiculous.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Good when it let's you listen to the music you choose. It's sticky sometimes, I would have to close and reopen the app just to play my song, and after it plays the songs on your playlist it makes you listen to "suggested songs" for at least a week (if you want to listen to the playlist). I'm sorry but there should be a separate feature for suggested songs because if I'm on my day to day commute I want to listen to the music I picked. Most of the time it doesn't give me trouble though.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I love Spotify and I've been using it for years but more recently I've found that I hate the new shuffle feature, it will randomly activate at a random song and I won't even know. I've also been experiencing my songs just stoping, it'll say it's still playing but the audio just stops. I have to pause and un-pause it to get the audio to play but then it'll do it a few minutes after. I've cleared my cache and updated my phone and the app but it still happens. Someone fix it, please!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is a great app. I have been a premium user for several years now and have had a great overall experience. With the notable exception of the last month. The app has been consistently breaking, not connecting to the internet. As a premium user, I think, "Well, that's okay, I download all my music for a reason." But that doesn't even remotely matter when the app is still CONSTANTLY loading, even in offline mode, as if it were trying to connect to the weakest of weak signals. Fix this.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I constantly move between areas with and without reception, and the app does not handle this sort of thing well. Even with all my songs downloaded, it constantly tells me that I'm offline. Also, I like to use my old phone to play music on my amp..and then control on my regular phone through the app. It's great that this feature exists at all..but they've had it available for years and it's still as buggy and laggy as it was when it was introduced. Otherwise, Spotify is great

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: After god knows how many years, the app finally feels lightweight and quick. No more minutes of waiting before it loads in. No more waiting a million years to turn off shuffle because of Smart shuffle (still buggy tho). However, the "remove from playlist" button is placed way too high, so it's easily pressed accidentally. No way to undo either, so the song will be gone you won't have any idea which song it was either. No way to retrieve it either. Very inconvenient. Do the devs even use the app?

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Good new music, I'm using since 2019. But the last UI update is quite useless - if I like the song, it's easier for me just put the like (heart icon) and it will automatically go to the liked playlist. Also I'm creating other playlists to combine the music for different purposes. But now it's just plus icon, and if I'm looking to my created playlist, I didn't see which songs I liked. Quite uncomfortable. If you fix it back, will give 5 stars.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have several PCs in my home with speakers, and I originally got the Spotify app on the premise that I could broadcast the same playlist on multiple PCs simultaneously. Searching Google led me to believe this was possible. Turns out you cannot do this, as the Groups feature was removed, and Connect does not support this. As such, I'm giving it a mere two starts as a app until a feature is introduced that allows me to do what I originally intended for the app.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: App has reached a point where the removal or redesign of features that haven't caused any issues have plagued the app. You can't simply like a song anymore without opening a window with all of your playlists and you can't tell you don't have a song liked if it's in one of your playlists (the checkmark icon). You can't add or remove playlists to your profile without making them private? No clue why a lot of the changes that have been made to this app were approved, please fix it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I did a bit of research and after 2 or 3 songs, 4 to 6 ads will play. ranging each about 30 seconds, there is an equal amount of ad to video. I think I'd rather just download every song and play it myself, because I'll still save copious amounts of time hearing about stuff I don't care about whatsoever. the premium plans are despicable, and the ads on the homepage while navigating to where you want to be are unbearable too. just put the extra effort in and grab some playlists to download.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: 01/23/2024: Your update needs fixing! I have a few playlists that I saved for over a year and I can't seem to edit my playlist properly. I think there is a bug or something. I mean I like how you add the tick button to the liked songs and all playlists, thats cool. But really don't like the random song changes. You always seem to change alot and thinking to made things easy but in a way its MORE harder! Do better Spotify!!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The free version should be a lot better than it actually is. I don't mind listening to ads, but the notion of creating a playlist only for Spotify to add a load of random songs to it really irritates me and defeats the whole object of creating a playlist. The search feature is next to useless, you find a song attempt to play it and it plays a totally different song lol. Is it any wonder the pirate/torrent industry is so popular!?

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm editing my review because a couple reinstalls did fix offline mode, but navigation has become difficult in this app in general, and it's very difficult to add the same song more than once to a playlist. My playlists randomly unsort themselves. The algorithm kinda keeps me trapped in the same groups of music and makes it hard to search for new music, I wish it could switch off. Enhance shuffle will also randomly turn on after turning it off. I like discover weekly because it's not intrusive.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It feels like every update makes the app worse. The added random tiktok version song button on the album is completely useless to me (who would use this when they're already on the album instead of just playing a song.) So I would just ignore this button, but every time you go on a album the button animates which is really annoying when you're never going to use it. I just hope they give you the option to disable the button, or at least the animation.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Works fine, but every few updates, the app either removes a good feature, adds an unneeded feature, changes a song's genre listing to either boost the song or boost the genre, or adds a bug that sours the user experience. These are just some of the plights I have about the app. They do add good features some times and fix the bugs often, but testing time for some of these updates should be extended before release. The app is overall good for what it is supposed to do, and I recommend it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I've used Spotify for so long and mostly loved my experience, but Smart Shuffle is one of the worst additions I've ever seen since the inception of apps. It's one thing if you want to try implementing something like this as an optional feature, but setting it to on as default and being completely unable to deactivate it is ridiculous. I don't know if somebody needed to justify their job and tried making something new, but this has completely ruined the app for me.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: People need to stop bending over for Spotify they keep making the app more annoying to deal with, instead of letting us put the pointless features they are there no matter what. Besides that, the app gets super buggy with shuffle and "retarted shuffle" every time I take it off it goes to the beginning of my playlist. I don't want that there's a reason why I took it off to begin with. Not to go all the way back to the playlist. This is why I don't pay for Spotify anymore and just take it off web.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Multiple times for each song or podcast when I am listening to songs with my Bluetooth headphones, it will just stop randomly. It occurs on wifi and data. It occurs in downloaded songs and not downloaded songs. The pause button it still there when it happens, so it looks like itâ€™s playing, but the audio stays stuck. It is occurring once every 30 seconds. I've noticed it only occurs with Bluetooth 5.1 devices but not with devices using older versions of Bluetooth.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I always loved Spotify but for a last few weeks it act worse on my device. They add lots of new features but it seems to affect core functionality: music playback. It often resets your current queue if you connect from other device or reopen the app after some time. Also the navigation is far from perfect (I prefer albums over playlists buy that's Spotify's "thing", I guess). I was always advocating it for my friends but with the recent issues not even sure if I'd like to keep using it longer

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The ads for the free version have become ridiculous. They are literally everywhere. You change your music selection? Ad. Scrolling through the playlists for music? Ad. Not to mention there are literally ads at the bottom of the screen when you're looking at what song you're listening to. Sometimes you get ads not even 30 minutes into your music session. Plus, the cost for premium has gone up; and it's not like they added any new features.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: My music keeps pausing for no apparent reason. When I open the app it says 'No internet connection', except I do have WiFi and regardless my music is downloaded so why should that matter!? And not to mention smart shuffle, a stupid pointless feature, keeps randomly turning on even though I have it disabled! This app is just broken. It shouldn't be so hard to make a functioning music app ffs Spotify!!!

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Love the app for the most part. I do pay for the premium. I take it biking, in my car, kayaking, in the garage... everywhere. My only complaint is the new 'like' button. You used to be able to like/unlike from the main screen. Now to unlike a song, you have to go to your liked songs and scroll to find it, and unlike from there. You can imagine how frustrating this is when on a bike or kayaking on the river trying to unlike one you accidentally clicked. Please bring the old button back.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify for almost 10 years now, it has served me well. But now, it has been changed a lot. Like they replaced the heart button (Liked button) by a plus button to add it faster to a playlist which it already exists on the menu (3 dots on the top right) now it's confusing to add it or just like it. Secondly, the suggestion songs are more than the main songs, it's annoying. Last but not least, WHY ALL THAT CASH??? WHAT ARE YOU STORING ON MY PHONE???? Sometimes it hits 5GB.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Based purely on the podcast section. Unintuitive UI. Impossible to pick a series and play through each episode. Ads in podcasts even though I pay premium. Struggle to find where podcasts I follow can be found. Constantly showing me podcasts I am not subscribed to trying to get me to subscribe, of which I have zero intrest in. Easiest fix would be a 'playlist'option for podcasts, exactly the same as for music on the app.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: This app is great!... for the price. Interface is easy to use and the algorithm works wonder in suggestions. Bug with listening device selection was fixed so I gave it another star, but now I've realized that the "hide this song" from a specific playlist doesn't work. We need an incognito mode! Private session is annoying to activate, doesn't work with Google Home and it doesn't specify if it's the same as incognito.I listen to repetitive music for sleeping that I do not want it on my algorithm.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Has cool personalized playlists, and a variety of podcasts to explore. The fact that disabling shuffle mode is a premium-only feature is tremendously annoying, however. If I just want to listen to one song at the start of a playlist, I can't, because of this unnecessary restriction. I have just a few liked songs, why does Spotify have to add some more random songs in the like playlist without my consent??? I understand that Premium must restrict a few features, but why this one?

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Excessive amount of bugs all around. The music often won't play and I have to restart the app, the menu for "show artist/album" also often won't load, and when spotify is open on the computer as well, the problems just compound. The only reason I put up with the bugs is the great student discount, but considering how the app has been the last 2-3 months, this may well be the end...

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Excessive amount of bugs all around. The music often won't play and I have to restart the app, the menu for "show artist/album" also often won't load, and when spotify is open on the computer as well, the problems just compound. column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

It makes the ads start over too. ðŸ˜’

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Great library, generally easy to use. Negatives: Search feature sometimes just doesn't work. I'm connected to wifi, but it will hang for 5 minutes plus without giving any results. Just the loading circle. UX with using it in airplane mode is also really poor, even in offline mode sometimes it just won't play downloaded songs. Still better than YouTube music.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using this app for last 3 to 4 years. This app is just becoming like other apps. I can't even choose what song I want to play at the moment or even skip songs without the premium feature. Not even giving half an hour playtime without ads. Other than that I was logging in the account with premium invite by a family member and I can't even log into that. It shows the address match then shows error in the next tab. Just becoming worse day by day.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Wish it cost less for premium, but it's almost worth the subscription honestly. I HATE ads in my music, and some days I skip even the songs I love the most. The "made for you" lists are almost always on point, with songs I either already love, or brand new faves. Love that the updated "add to Playlist" feature FINALLY lets you add a song to many playlists at once; I've been waiting for this update since I started making playlists originally! Still, they're charging about 5$ too much, IMO.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Was frustrated when they made us to restrict to got to previous songs and choose the playback feature even after listening/watching loads of Advts. Now I can't even listen to my songs from my playlist and skip the songs with restricted access. Why the hell do they make us watch/listen to the Ads. No use of keeping this app installed anymore. Wynk Seems to be the best alternative.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Honestly really good (for me at least) when it comes to listening to music. I have premium, and imo it's worth it, but that might just be me. but when I tried to reorganize my main playlist just to make everything easier on my perfectionist ah brain, it keeps moving VALENTINE (MÃ¥neskin) to the top of the Vocaloid section. That's less of a criticism more of an inconvenience, but it's really annoying cuz I get bothered by the little things. Also sometimes it just won't play a song despite being on

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Update. Clearly you either listen to things the Spotify way or not at all. This fact remains. They changed feature priorities though. Automix no longer turns on automatically. The new *it* feature is Smart Shuffle it turns on automatically, despite one of the whole selling points of paying is that you can listen in any order. Try to turn off? The app crashes. I've uninstalled and reinstalled, restarted my phone. App remains absolute garbage with no concern for the user.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Bring back the Playlist radio function as soon as possible! The "Enhance" feature is really not good for finding songs! I really don't get, why spotify keeps removing features that people use! ðŸ˜‘ðŸ˜‘ Edit: This app is getting increasingly worse. I only want to listen to music. Instead I now get shorts? Please at least add an option to remove the shorts!!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The Android app has gone steadily downhill since 2019. They've shown time and time again where all of their efforts have gone. Apple, podcasts, and ebooks. It constantly freezes, won't connect to Alexa, and takes long to open. They've removed feature after feature and replaced it with nothing. Where did playlists based off playlists go? Where did daily playlists go? Where did good song recommendations go?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify just keeps getting worse and worse for those who can't afford Spotify's premium plans. You get multiple ads after a couple of songs, the "30 minutes of ad free listening" is 15 at best, and to top it all off, smart shuffle is constantly enabled on playlists. You used to be able to turn the smart shuffle off in settings, but now you can't. The regular shuffle button isn't even an option unless you pay for premium. I'm extremely frustrated with how unusable it's become for free plan users.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The addition of smart shuffle has been awful. Switching between shuffle on and off has become buggy, requiring repeated turning off and on for it to stay off when switching between songs. When you want to stop shuffling at one song so you can go to the next in the playlist, it resets to the first song in the playlist, rather than where you were at. It's unintuitive, annoying, and buggy. This feature alone makes me want to switch entirely to SoundCloud.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The reason I'm rating this so high is because I love music and this app brings me music. Constant tiny pauses in the music, and some very long pauses, sometimes the music stops and you can see the song timer still moving. When you look for a Playlist of any kind the computer will just bundle your favorite list and play that so its hard to find new music. And if you're looking for instrumental music you will inevitably get some with lyrics in that Playlist.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Subscription REQUIRED!!! I have been using this app for years. from free to subscription. the songs that plays here sounds better than the others. But once I stopped using subscription I found some fatal features that's newly locked by subscription such as loop, jump to specific time, and the old frustrating overlapping ads with 30secs each with different volume which often makes me jumpy when it shows! And not often after an ad it play something else which means I have to search my song again.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The radio algorithm is repetitive. Adding to a que is clunky and ineffective. There's no "play next" button. You can't add a whole album to a que and it stay in order. You can't cue up multiple albums and them stay in order. I hat this program, but Google Music shutdown and this is slightly better than YouTube Music. Anyone have a good option out there? Edit: the longer I use this, the more I hate it. It's so clunky. Edit: with every update the app gets worse...

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Loved Spotify until it started turning 'smart shuffle' on by itself. That really damaged my trust, when I tried to use familiar songs to manage an anxiety attack and got something completely different without any warning. No one wants this feature and there's no option to permanently disable it. I've started looking into other streaming services.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm in love this app and have used it for multiple years, but lately I've been having issues with it: - The first songs of a playlist randomly changing place and replacing each other, without me even trying to do so, and if I attempt to fix this, it'll ignore any changes I do. - No longer having the ability to list playlists on my profile; the button for it disappeared completely and I have no way to do this unless I go on desktop, which is rather inconvenient. Please fix these bugs asap ðŸ™

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was such a good app to listen music, with lyrics and a variety of great music. You could even explore new songs with it's new feature in the playlist section, it would add songs in the playlist according to the particular kind of playlist. You could even put a song on repeat, now? Nah. It has become trash. Every little thing needs a premium now. A person can't even listen music peacefully without spending money on apps. As the app gets new updates, it keeps getting worse. Disappointing.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Almost every month there is a feature, which definitely was authored by "not very intelligent" person. As example - you are not able to remove song from favorite in app anymore. Why? Algorithm for songs is very lazy - if you're listening song of certain genre, this song will be in playlist for months. Every "renewal" for playlist - mostly shanking up plus not or two new songs at best.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I dont want to notice updates to this app, just play my music! Smart shuffle is so annoying, I have to click the button five or six times to turn normal shuffle on and off with all the lag from removing and adding the smart recommendations, and Ive not used it once. Constantly changing the system for liked songs is also irritating, it was fine 6,7 years ago, leave it alone! Better algorithmic suggestions are awesome but make new places for them, dont mess up tried and true systems.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: wish i could give this app a negative rating. ive been using spotify for years now and i loved it because of its interface and large variety in music. unfortunately the app has put even the most basic features like looping and rewinding songs behind a paywall. definitely not good marketing, pretty sure many people wouldn't want to pay for the bare minimum.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I have listened to music on this app for so long. But the new features are ridiculous. I understand that you want users to buy subscription,so you auto-shuffle the list. But this smart shuffle doesn't even play songs from a playlist when it is specifically asked to do so. Now Spotify is irritating. I took a week-subscription and was disappointed with the experience. I was told that I got 14 days subscription but the download list disappeared in a week. Will switch apps soon

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The "Spotify Connect" has been the bane of my existence. Please remove it or allow the feature to be turned off. This feature" is more of a hindrance and intrusive than any app I've seen to date. This feature automatically turns on Spotify whenever I turn off Netflix or Youtube or when I take my headphones off my ear (my when my headset comes off). I listen to videos a lot with my headphones across multiple apps and when spotify starts playing I get enraged. Close to deleting.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Honestly, I used to love spotify so much. It was my go to music platform, but recently I feel like it's nothing more than a cash cow. Premium is required just to listen to the songs you want, and it keeps adding songs I don't like into my playlist. And if I want to have actual control over my playlist I have to pay $10.99 USD per month, and I just don't have that kind of money. The app is so good before the premium requirement feature was implemented. Please, I'm beggin, make spotify free again.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was very smooth and good in the beginning.But slowly lot's of premium features are coming.If we don't have one we'll not be able to scroll the songs,play any songs in the middle, too much ads.Like now I can't even choose what I have to listen. It's annoying actually. First I thought it will be a nice app. But actually I was wrong..Creator of this app can change the problems, then we can also change our feedbacks. Thanks for this types of annoying features!!!!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I have used Spotify for years and am a premium subscriber. Lately this app has gone backwards big time. It is unstable and crashes, it used to remember what episode you were up to in a podcast list now it automatically goes to the top and you have to scroll through until you find where you were up to and it used to be when you liked an album it automatically added the songs to your library, now you have to add them all individually. Such a shame a once user friendly app has become a mess

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has been ridiculous since the recent updates. It seems way too concerned with forcing an algorithm and playing music you don't like. Every time I open the app it starts playing a random track from a random artist that, often, I've never heard of. No setting to disable that. Also, "smart shuffle" is a really dumb idea and despite an overwhelmingly negative reception of this feature, there is no setting to permanently disable. The app is also just seeming very bugged and glitchy lately.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3:
been using Spotify since 2011. ive always simped for it, but lately with every update it gets worse. now i cant even listen to playlists or songs added to my queue, it just plays whatever it wants. if i hit the back button it plays the songs in the playlist like normal, but otherwise, i've turned off auto mix and smart shuffle and it still does it. cancelling premium until this is resolved âœŒðŸ?

column5: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

You can't make such stupid mistakes.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Also, on this app, when you want to play a song, random and different songs pop up, and they don't play the song you want it is very frustrating.you only get 7 skips a day unless you have premium but other that that it is ok.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

You can return this feature and improve on what was not there before. That's more reasonable.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

Laptop/computer if I'm relaxing or sitting down. And no loop!? Seriously!?

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

I really like the option to differentiate between music and podcasts because if it were altogether, it'd be a nightmare. I was using tidal and Google podcast. Since Google podcast is moving to the garbage platform that is YouTube music, I've come back to Spotify as it provides both.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Corportate greed is at an all time high it seems.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

It creates a playlist and it is impossible to tell if the songs are "liked" unless I play them, and then click the already checked button. So many steps for what used to be so simple brain dead design

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify for a number of years has had this bug with trying to scrub/search on playback. If you end up tapping parts of the playback bar in too fast succession, the playback bar becomes unresponsive - moving the slider does not correlate to where the song is actively playing. Only an app restart will fix this. It's not app breaking, but it's kind of annoying when quickly trying to go to a very specific section of the song/podcast. I noticed this years ago on my S10+, and still on my S23 Ultra.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Why are you removing good features?!! You've replaced the heart icon on the now playing screen but a + button to add to seperate playlist. Every change you make is not for the benefit of the end user. You keep making what was once a great app more convoluted and inconvenient to use. Edit 15/01/24: SMART SHUFFLE IS AWFUL, BIN IT!!! Subscription price increases, a smart shuffle feature that you are no longer able to disable which actively slows down the app. Truly awful.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: App behaves in bizarre and unpredictable ways. Its like AI run amuck. Shuffles playlists when shuffle isnt on, plays songs not even in the playlist, and will play non-downloaded songs when not on wifi, even though that feature is turned off. The chat support function is supremely frustrating and impossible to find...why is it not built into the app? If Spotify's response here is to contact them directly...sure, but how about you make it easy to do so first? Its like you dont really want us to.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using Spotify premium for several years. The first major overhaul of the app put ALL of my music in one list and unfollowed EVERY artist. (Years ago now) I dealt with it, did what I could to organize my collection. This latest update has made it really frustrating to delete songs from a list, as now there isn't a button that's easily accessible to do so. Tedious to click through different windows to delete each song from an album individually.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The app barely functions. Every time I open the app it takes at least a full minute for it to get past this black loading screen, then it takes another whole minute for any of the buttons to do their job, then it takes another whole minute for the song to start playing. This app only has the job of playing music and it cannot do this.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The download feature only downloads like, half of my playlists? It just picks and chooses which songs it downloads? That has never happened before. Please fix your buggy, garbage app. And we're still waiting on the day where Spotify's shuffle actually shuffles music instead of picking the same order no matter what. Shuffle should SHUFFLE, how is that so difficult to grasp?

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The free version of the app is basically useless now. Every basic feature in any music streaming app is exclusive to premium accounts here, where in order to listen to songs in the playlist without songs being automatically to the queue needs premium, seeking to the next song needs premium, changing the order of songs in the queue needs premium and the list goes on.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Download lists need constant updating with no new songs actually added to the lists. I know my phone will sit there trying to download a list, just get stuck on the last percentage, and chew through my phone battery for no reason until I completely close the app as well.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

This was my favourite app where I always encouraged more of my friends to use this and now I feel its of no use. So disappointed !

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: A great app, but recently it got extremely laggy, especially in "Liked songs".It takes like 10 seconds to run a song. Also I really really don't like smart shuffles, as they making everything even more laggy. Right now, basically, when I click on the shuffle button it switches it's state with some noticeable lag to the point that the state switches 2-n times . It's super frustrating to use and I would love to have an option to disable smart shuffles entirely.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The point of premium was offline use since I don't have home wifi. Will resubscribe before und of promo if fixed. Was acting weird before last update, now won't work at all.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

I appreciate the audio books for prime members but that's the only positive feature in the last 4+ updates. I miss the headings where you could scroll through multiple suggested playlists by type.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Smart shuffle being integrated to the shuffle button sucks too. Smart shuffle still sucks

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Another is when I play a song and when I switched to another song the notification shows me the incorrect song.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify continues to find ways to make their UI worse. Now when you connect a bluetooth headset, Spotify places a "For You" section in your notification bar and on your lock screen. Interacting with it usually does nothing, which is somehow preferred. If it does work, Spotify will start playing content you probably weren't opening the app to listen to. Yes, Spotify really introduced a feature that gives users a better experience when it doesn't work. I can't wait for this company to die.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

"Improvements" that just complicate things and cause problems are not improvements.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Lately, podcasts just haven't been loading (not a network issue). This typically happens when I'm trying to resume a podcast. I should be able to have a podcast queue and book queue separate from my music queue so that switching between these categories doesn't clear the music queue.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has now keeps changing my music orders in the playlist, which is not right. Plus, this Smart Shuffle is pointless as it's added other music that's not in my playlist to Shuffle. I'm definitely going to look at alternative & or go back to downloading making playlists the old way.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: As stated in a previous review, I hate that it auto connects to Bluetooth. I have small children and connect to speakers to play music for them. I am getting rid of premium and deleting the app until this can be fixed. I looked online and this has been a problem for at least 5 years. Unacceptable in my opinion. I turned off all permissions and the background data and it still plays. Probably will never get this service again.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I hate this trend with apps constantly changing their UI in ways that are not necessary and not giving users options to customize it. Every time Spotify changed its layout, I got used to it pretty quick, but changing the heart to the plus just ruined the system I had with playlists. The fact that it also applied to car mode seems entirely counterintuitive to the point of car mode to keep the interface simple. There are other issues I have with current Spotify that I just can't fit in the review.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify is a servicable app with a solid library of works I liked using. However, I absolutely despise their strategy when a user cancels their premium subscription which I am doing now. The fact that after cancelling, but before the premium runs out (so the app is still paid), I now have very annoying pop-ups in-app and rude e-mails asking me to reconsider, makes me never want to resubsrice. This UX element is hateful, among other new updates such as smart-shuffle and removing the like button.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

The (basic) features are also being stripped away such as playing whatever song we like, skipping songs, etc. The experience has now deteriorated to a level that the app is now very hard to use on a regular basis.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Like the feature to make Spotify look in specific folder for music files rather add every single audio file in library.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Second, there's no obvious way to tyrn off this feature. There's a lot of options so many it's somewhere, but I shouldn't have to hunt it down. Is it so hard to include a search feature for options?

Doesn't load quickly and negatively impacts the entire listening experience. As a premium user I would appreciate being able to PERMANENTLY disable Smart Shuffle. EDIT: still cannot permanently disable smart shuffle and still VERY frustrated by the playback issues this broken feature causes.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have used spotify for years and finally got the premium because the app barely works if you don't have it. But now it won't let me edit my own playlists, shuffle is useless ans the smart suggestion is annyoing. Tech support was a waste of time, so completely confused on why you should spend money in a subscription for an app that has so many bugs and useless annoying features

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been on this app for over 5 years and it's been a neverending source of frustration. 3 ads for every 2 songs. The most annoying ad campaign; "Hey. Don't you hate when your music gets interrupted?" "You mean like you just did?" "Yeah!" Seriously. F off. The only reason I'm even leaving a review is because the app has started crashing up to 3 times in a single song. For such a large and old company to be so unstable, you should be ashamed. Worst app I've ever tolerated

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: (UPDATE: They changed it back. Thank you) The new UI is awful and I dread opening the app. I've had premium spotify for over 10 years, but this update is so bad that I may abandon it. I avoid the home page at all costs, it's not useful, it autoplays songs when I don't want it to. It's really jarring in every way and it's so hard to navigate. Please so something about this. Or at least let us revert to the old layout if we want to. :(

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Recent changes to Spotify Free in India have made the service frustrating to use. Basic features like playing songs in order and skipping within tracks are now restricted, significantly diminishing the user experience. While I understand the need to encourage premium subscriptions, these limitations are too severe. I hope Spotify reconsiders these changes to better balance user satisfaction with their business goals.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Premium features should be locked behind their paywall, not used to frustrate us into spending money which is Spotify's main profit method. Their exceptionally annoying ads are a great example, and so is the fact that I just added 20+ podcasts to my queue only to realize that access to said queue is a premium feature. Never liked Spotify but now I'm really really done. I can get my podcasts on YouTube

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I hate this app so much now, I used to listen to spotify everytime but now I hate way too much. I cannot reverse the song, the reverse button is now closed. And no option for playing one song on repeat. I cant even listen to a particular part of any song, no matter what, if I want to listen to any part again I'll have to start over again with the song. I even tired to update it but no change.I hate this app so much nowðŸ˜¤. It's the same thing again even after I have updated it 2 times.ðŸ¤¬

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I have to address a very big issue, and that's the lack of features with the free spotify plan. It simply feels like they are almost forcing you to buy the premium plan, the amount of ads you get shown. three 30 second ads and two 15 second ads. you only get 6 skips per hour, with the inability to peak at the next song (in the free plan), it feels cruel at times. I have premium, and I dread the experience of ever losing my subscription. The free plan is truly crippling and miserable.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Overall it's ok. My major complaint is that the thumbs up/down feature regarding commercials doesn't work. There have been a couple commercial I thumbed down because I found the content offensive, and yet they played over and over and over. Why give me an option to thumb it down if you aren't going to respond to it? Frustrating!

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It really needs a "shuffle all library" feature for artists you follow. Making playlists to include what you want is daunting and involves too much micromanaging if you listen to multiple genres. The DJ was kind of getting to this but the narrator is annoying and eventually (surprising quickly) it circles back to the exact same songs

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: New update is terrible. You used to be able to see an entire row of choices in a category. Now it shows one tile. Browsing new music or recommended playlist is tedious. Update: Oh no! The app got worse, I'm getting ads pushed to my home page. Trevor Noah sucks but spotify REALLY wants someone to listen to him.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: You only get 6 skips per hour, and you have a limit of tapping a song of your choice if you have no premium. Basically, it's like forcing you to go premium with no hassle. It's a headache, a nuisance. I would do you a 0 star or lesser than that, if I actually could. It's now utterly useless if you'd like to choose your song of your choice with no disturbance of the utter disgrace and the sheer green button I see daily of the "Get Premium" on your screen. I like the Spotify before this nonsense.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Seems that the like song feature has been removed. The last update seemed to have removed this ability from the app. Before you were able to search a song, tap on the 3 dots to the far right of the song, a drop down menu shows up and the very first feature should be like song. It has been removed, the only way to like a song is to play that song then while it is playing you can like the song. Please fix this feature and add it back.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Horrible app... Idek where to start, A music app that doesn't let you play the music you wanna listen to and won't let you skip more than 6 times per hour? It forces you to pay 11 euros every month for a feature you have for free on other apps. Ads are 3 times louder than the music itself (personally I listen at a very loud volume setting with headphones) my ears and head hurt every time I get an ad (which is not in a 30 minute interval like they say BTW) Best to just avoid this app honestly

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I was premium for years but the quality has declined to lowest available. It was great but they've honestly removed EVERY function of worth. Still no way to shuffle all. No more daily or custom Playlists. Cant even browse for music anymore as they've removed SCROLLING. In fact, No more real home page content at all. Just fullscreen icons that merely function as thumbnails. ANY other app is better for music. It's now just a clunkier tiktok. Oh, Now less reliable and more repetitive algorithm too

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify do better! You still gonna make me listen to sounds that aren't on my playlist? I'll choose a sound that I want to litesn to and press play to hear a completely different song playing. I HATE THAT. And you be playing my sounds in random order but you have to pay for that same feature in premium. But guess what I don't like that. From now on I'll be using my laptop to listen to music because it gives me my music how I like it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The music selection is great, but the app often says there is no Internet connection when there is, doesn't display all features sometimes, runs slow and generally makes me angry almost every day. This is a more recent thing. Fix it.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: it's great pretty much perfect as can be, but can you bring the heart feature back? I like the new thing, it's easier to add to songs to playlists, but it's a bit of an inconvenience to press the "Add to Playlist" button to add/remove a song to my liked songs. maybe integrate both onto the song page? please and thank you - coming from a premium and paying customer

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The new + feature sucks. When I go into my liked songs list and search for artists like Jazmine Sullivan I get no results, where if I go through normal search it says that the song is already in my liked songs playlist. Also my daily drive has been playing the same songs over and over again. I've tried listening to different songs and emptying my cache but it's not working. Algorithms always suck.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Without premium, this app runs like garbage, every time I go back into the app, it plays a random suggested song that is NOWHERE near the preferences I have and CONSTANTLY puts a few songs I hate back into playlists regardless of whether or note I press the "do not play again" button. Runs great with premium, but has it's annoying downsides. Unless you're getting premium for it, don't get it.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Premium still inserts ads on podcasts. Standard Podcast player features are non existent, the interface is completely unintuitive, and Spotify keeps buying my favorite shows. Still the worst podcatcher, and somehow manages to get objectively worse instead of better. For example, when sorted by date, newest podcasts play first. It's backwards. This app just sucks. Spotify sucks at podcasts and YouTube music is way better at music. Why does this app even exist?

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have my playlist arranged do that all my favourite artists songs are at the top, for some reason it keeps removing the top one and putting a random song in place?? Its really bad bc it triggers my perfectionism, but also swaps places with the other song so when I'm queing songs I can no longer find it since I've had the same layout for a while and am quite familiar with where everything should be. Please fix this. If it is an update, remove it.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Works 20% of the time. Constatly stops playing, songs re-start suddenly. App refuses to run in the background even though all my settings allow it. Audio quality is poor and often crackles out. The app itself doesnt auto-shuffle playlists well and is usually very glitchy. The like-fucntion is gone on my device and the app will not update. I also cannot access the customer help page.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The like button has been basically nerfed- I can't see my liked songs anymore w/o going to the likes playlist and the "like" button is now a plus that is sometimes checked even when the song is not liked and just in one of my playlists. i dont understand why a 'like' button and 'add to playlist' button cant be side by side instead of being one button?? not user friendly while driving or multi-tasking anymore. if not reversed honestly will cancel my subscription

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I pay premium for downloading music, but recently all my playlists have been missing downloads. I click on the download playlist button but there's songs that still aren't available online. I've tried downloading and re-downloading the playlist and clearing my cache and downloads. I didn't want to reinstall the app but I don't know if that's the only solution now. Please fix this.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Please please PLEASE enable 'not interested' or 'do not show again' button for suggested podcasts especially. It's been years since spotify exist but you don't have this function??How is it impossible to customize our own homepage for this app when we can easily choose what we want to see and hear on other apps??? Fix this soon or I'm not gonna bother keeping the app anymore.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: I love a lot of the features and the special "things" that set Spotify apart. The download is clutch when 8 miss a payment on my phone bill. It would be 5 stars if I could find some of the rare singles or lesser pushed artists from my area. Other than the limited (slightly) artist it still offers a wide range of things.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Literally the worst app ever. I want to play a song in my playlist but it only plays a little section now, what is a playlist for anyways?! I can't even skip the song and it was playing songs that weren't even in my playlist and when it finally played a song in the playlist i wanted, IT DIDNT EVEN START AT THE TOP. when i wanted to skip forward i couldn't. It didn't even let me so it could go on to the next song. So I clicked skip and it said "Pay for premium." JUST LEMME GO TO THE SONG I WANT.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: SEVERELY DISAPPOINTED. Fast forward button is limited to only 15 seconds! I wrongly assumed that this was to motivate subscribers to pay for premium but unfortunately, regardless of which type of account you hold, there is no remedy. Additionally, upgrading your account only gets rid of ads during music, NOT podcasts - I could understand if ads were at least kept to the beginning & end of episodes but nope. Ridiculous considering even Stitcher Radio & Audible offered multiple forwarding options.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I've been using this app for more than 4 years and it's always been amazing I love all the new features they add to the app and I love how they include so many different artists on the app it's the best music player I've ever used.Edit-I think Spotify is a great music app but only for music. The audio book thing is such a scam. They only offer 15 hours of "free listening" when I'm already paying for premium and when you pass the 15 hours they have you pay MORE MONEY to listen to the audio book.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Convenient, but no superstar. Pandora and YouTube are where I discover more new music, and sometimes Spotify doesn't have the songs I am looking for. Their algorithms just pump the same songs in my ears to the point where I get sick of them too soon... Update. I use Spotify as my primary source of music collection and am discovering some new music and some features have improved but they still are slow to add simple features. Recommendations for playlists are rarely songs I hadn't considered.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: There needs to be a feature that will allow me to remove shuffle from the options, it keeps turning its self on and shuffling the playlist I'm listening to and I don't usually notice till I'm right in the middle of a chore and can't get to my phone to shut off shuffle and then I have to go through and try to find the last song on my list that I was listening to. I pay for premium so I don't get interrupted by ads so why would I want to get interrupted by songs I don't like.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Going back to YouTube music. Your customer service SUCKS. I've been contacting support for 3 months for having to change profile pic at least 3 times to get it to new photo + profile pic disappears randomly // Spotify suggestion website DOESN'T WORK to suggest these ideas (1) edit, delete, create folders on mobile (2) add cover images to folders (3) add notes about songs in playlists (4) have sections or chapters to a playlist to separate certain song vibes from others

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: (premium user) i HONESTLY love this app, every feature, interface is user friendly but but the only problem am facing recently is that they don't show the lyrics. it might be available in phone but if you look for them in pc then it goes along the lines 'not available....couldn't load'. it's seriously getting frustrating at this point, if even after paying for premium the app is proving useless i have no choice but to cancel the subscription.

column2: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
column3: It's the user interface and the lyrics seeking feature for me. One can use the lyrics to seek the music or drag the music to any part of the same song. I have never seen that on any music app. The user interface and theming as well are both awesome. Well done team Spotify! However, there's a feature I really need now. Please let each playlist have the memory of the last played song such that it continues from there or where the listener stopped upon clicking the play button on the playlist.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I was overall happy with the past features... but this recent update where the loop feature is gone and shuffle is constant makes this app worse than ever. I think this update was really unnecessary as there are many who are not allowed to spend money on apps... myself being one of them. Spotify, I think, can still be a profitable business and a popular music app without the new update. Would highly recommend bringing the old version back. Hoping this will be considered as positive criticism ðŸ˜Š

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Shuffle is completely broken. Regardless of whether I have shuffle activated or not in a playlist, it just plays the songs in the order of the playlist. Apparently it's a pretty common complaint. Pretty sad when the world's largest streaming company can't get a basic feature right.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Really pisses me off when every other song or halfway through a song, I either can't hear it or it is blasting and constantly have to mess with volume.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Update 22 Jan 2024: now won't play my like songs even though they are downloaded for offline.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have used Spotify for well over 5 years, most of the time I was free user, but last year I upgraded and got yearly premium everything was amazing, but when I got on free plan just a week ago, it's been a nightmare, most of the basic features are blocked too. Why can't I see my queue or even add a song to queue. I understand you want more people to opt for premium but you just can't make it an exclusive premium app either. Just last year Spotify free was usable but now unfortunately it's not.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: There is a weird glitch on Spotify right now where if you have the enhanced shuffle button on, half the songs in your liked Playlist won't play. You can click on them and they just do nothing. After weeks of trying to play music and switching over to Amazon music, we finally found the culprit. TURN OFF ENHANCED SHUFFLE. I'll still be using Spotify since we have a family account, but this minor glitch really gave us a huge headache. Not sure if the glitch is all devices or just android specific.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Currently on an S24 Ultra and have the same issues: Laggy, continuously glitching the shuffle button so it just keeps doing their awful "smart shuffle," and simply taking way too long to load when there are no connectivity issues and other apps operate just fine.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Seriously, is there a way to permanently disable that feature? It keeps randomly turning on while I'm driving, and frankly, it's terrible at knowing what I want to hear.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: It's horrible It takes forever to load it always says "spotify is offline" it never load when I'm listening to spotify on my Playlist it put different songs plus there is no lyrics I go to the lyrics section it says "no lyrics to this song" something like that plus I'm trying to put a song it takes forever to load to play the music spotify just wants you to buy premium you can't choose any song logging in takes forever I was trying to log in on my computer it wouldn't let me I hate the update..

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I also agree that they are adding too many new features that are making the app worse. Don't fix what isn't broken!!!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: Look the music isn't bad. At first the ads were okay, you could watch one and get 30mins adless music, but now you need to listen to 2 ads when changing a playlist and you don't even get that 30mins anymore it's SO annoying like why do we have to pay for everything another reason i dont like the ads is that theyre always so loud. column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

It plays one song and starts playing other random things...this sort of thing is baked into the Spotify app experience. The way the like button works had always been one of the dumbest ui decisions I've ever seen. Hearts for likes plus you add to library , should be simple. Not with this app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I love the music and layout I just hate the fact that for the last couple of months the volume will randomly drop to mute the app will shut off in the middle of a a song and when I restart the app it won't even pick up where I left off or even on the same playlist I have to manually restart everything I've done what tech support says to uninstall and reinstall the app and it still does it

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I like the app but I have two complaint. It took away the feature where you can set it to the SD card for storage space, so now it's taking my phone's storage instead of the card. Please put that feature back. Secondly, the new shuffle mode keeps turning on by itself and turning off by itself which is really annoying when I want my playlist shuffled but it either plays in order or plays a song I don't have. Please put that feature back and fix the special shuffle mode.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Not able to repeat or have ads is all things that can be worked around with for a non subscription user for a good music app with all songs and lyrics but taking away basic features like be able to go back and forward in a song and listen to specific parts also play in the order we like is just ridiculous in fact it doesn't make me want to buy the subscription instead turn to other apps coz it makes me uncomfortable to use an app which is so non friendly to unsubscribed users! Pls fix it

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: A podcast that was recommended for me is now in my "my shows" when I have no interest in it. It autoplayed its way in, I wish you'd add a feature to allow us the ability to remove it from there, even remove it from queue/autoplay. It's really annoying. Other than that, the app is good.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: For podcasts I would recommend using Doggcatcher. It can find more podcasts, allows full control of the order they play, and allows separate values to be used for auto downloading each podcast episode. The interface is also much cleaner. This tries to do too much. The only reason I keep Spotify is for Joe Rogan.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify's approach to charging for every basic function is extremely disappointing. Not only are users bombarded with ads unless they pay up, but even basic features like looping songs or fast-forwarding/backwarding are behind a paywall. It's frustrating to feel nickel-and-dimed for every little convenience. Considering the plethora of other streaming options available, Spotify's restrictive and monetized approach leaves much to be desired.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: Price went up for premium, possibly because of audio book inclusion? That was fine until I found out you're limited in the number of hours you can stream an audiobook. That's nowhere in the app itself, had to track down the info on the Google Play page. Odd you have to pay extra to finish a book that's over 15 hours or wait until next month, AND you can't "top up" in the app itself. Sounds like there's more advertising in free version, and they email about Duo even if you pay. Ease up on ads?
