column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Appreciate the ongoing improvements, but the recent Spotify update has left me somewhat disappointed. As a free user, I miss 1. the ability to drag the marker on the seekbar to play a specific part of a song, 2. the freedom to choose between "Shuffle" and "In Order" while keeping the "Smart Shuffle" as the default option and 3. ability to play the previous song. I believe these mentioned features are fundamental for any music player, based on my prior experiences. Thanks for attention...

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Appreciate the ongoing improvements, but the recent Spotify update has left me somewhat disappointed. As a free user, I miss 1. the ability to drag the marker on the seekbar to play a specific part of a song, 2. the freedom to choose between "Shuffle" and "In Order" while keeping the "Smart Shuffle" as the default option and 3. ability to play the previous song. I believe these mentioned features are fundamental for any music player, based on my prior experiences. Thanks for attention...

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I stopped using Spotify, not primarily due to ads, although they can be annoying. The main issue is the app's lack of flexibility for non-premium users. You can't rewind songs or easily go back to recently played tracks. Recently, they added a restrictive feature where you can't play the specific song you want without a premium subscription; they choose for you. Moreover, I've purchased premium multiple times, but as a student, it's financially challenging to do so every month

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: I love the app and use it all the time for music! I just have a couple of bits of criticism. First of all, the button for liking songs was changed the a much more confusing thing to use (and its ugly) , it was fine the way it was. Also, there are often glitches when I skip forward in a song by lyrics, it doesn't do anything. Also that sometimes, when you have music playing but have your phone screen off, it just stops playing at random.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: At one time, it had features like "sleep" so there was a timer on the app. However, I've recently noticed it was removed. I found it very useful for when you were going to sleep. Additionally, I find that the playlists in the sleep genre should automatically have a fade setting in place so the tracks merge with one another more smoothly. Aside from that. The app is great for playing your music and to listen to podcasts. No issues on that regard.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: love Spotify, but smart shuffle is so damn annoying. Having it be the same button as shuffle is an awful idea, it should be a separate button, and we should have the option to disable it in settings. I like to press shuffle to change the selection I'm currently listening to when I'm having trouble deciding what I want to hear, and this really gets in the way. It's especially problematic with downloaded playlists and slows everything down. I get the idea, but the approach is flawed in my opinion.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: For so long, the app has been great. The mixes are fantastic, to the point I haven't created my own playlist, since the ones the AI generates are pretty much spot on. That being said, around 2 months ago, I started having consistent issues where audio just stops, and the app has to reboot. This is especially prevalent while driving, and even more so when using navigation apps. Both Google Maps and Waze have issues, but only with Spotify; I haven't had the same issues with any other audio app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: With the recent update, basic features (such as shuffle, looping, moving the song marker (rewind-forward) and more) have been disabled for free users. THIS BORDERLINES MENTAL CRUELTY when you do it to long-time users of the app. I see no point in continuing with this app as my default music player. We had a good run, Spotify! The app is as good as FM-Radio now where you can request songs but have no control whatsoever!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I really loves Spotify and especially it's feature with podcasts ; being able to translate songs ; and playing songs at your own free will. Back then, we didn't really have many ads too. Now, we're forced to listen to songs without our free will only because a bunch of us cannot afford premium. I am very disappointed with this update. I expected better from Spotify. I'm so close to deleting Spotify and downloading another app for music.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify was the only music app on my phone. But now with the recent update, they have forced me to switch to a different app. Basic features like a loop, going to the previous track, a queue are now only available to premium users. The free version is not really a music app anymore, it's just a music database with an option to create playlists.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This used to be the best music streaming app ever but now it's just a money grab. The ads have become increasingly annoying, I get 2 to 3 ads after every 2 songs. Also in the recent update most of the basic features of the app have been locked in premium (play previous, shuffle, playing in order and even going to a specific point in the song). It's like they are forcing you to buy premium. Hugely disappointed. I hope you fix it. 0/10

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: "Unfortunately, the latest Spotify update has left me disappointed. The user interface changes feel counterintuitive, making it harder to navigate my music library. The removal of certain features that I used frequently is frustrating, and the new ones introduced don't seem to enhance the user experience. Moreover, I've encountered several bugs and crashes since the update, which significantly hinders my music listening.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Very disappointed with the latest update.All the basic features have been locked and require spotify premium to run. You can't go back to previous song, you can't select a specific part of the song to listen, you can't disable the shuffle mode, the loop mode is locked, the lyrics have been locked for free users. So basically, its a total downgrade now. What's the point of being a music app if you don't allow your users to listen music peacefully ?? I must say Spotify ain't a music app anymore.ðŸ˜‘

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has given us variety of options to listen to any songs in whichever way we wanted, like playing any part of the song, looping and repeating, playing any song in any order. But after a month, it has completly spoiled the music experience which all of us needed as they had switched all these features to premium, hence we are unable to enjoy music until we pay for the premium. Truly speaking, emotional damage to all music lovers......

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: This was my favourite music app. I use it every day. I would've given it a higher rating but the recent updates have been really disappointing. You have to pay for premium for even the most basic features. Most of the time the lyrics don't show, you have to buy premium to shuffle the songs and repeat them, songs that aren't even in your playlists keep playing and now you can't even fast forward, skip or backtrack a song. Didn't think an app will be this desperate for its users to buy premium.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: IT WAS ABSOLUTELY FINE TILL THE RECENT UPDATE. I absolutely loved using the app. But the recent update spoiled everything. If you don't have Spotify premium,You cannot play songs in order anymore.Or backtrack songs. Or put songs on repeat. LIKE BRO, these are the main,basic and core features of a music app. In its 20-ish year history Spotify has never had a profitable year,I know they desire to change that,BUT THIS IS NOT THE WAY. If they don't go back from this, this will be the end of Spotify

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Editing my review after 3 years: They have made it mandatory to purchase a premium subscription to skip to your favorite part of a song, and you can't replay it while playing. These are basic features of a music app, but now you have to pay for them. So bad. Free music with ads is still tolerable and understandable, but this stunt is so cheap. I have been using Spotify for about 3 years and considered it the finest music app. But no, it's absolutely disgusting now. Uninstalling it on the way.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The recent update is ridiculous. It removed some basic features like playing previous song, skipping songs as much as I like, playing a certain part of the lyrics, playing songs in the way I want etc. and put it as premium. They are literally forcing us to get premium. It used to be the best app for music listening and now, it's the worst. So disappointed!!

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I use Spotify all the time, at home, in my car.... I have premium to listen without ads, and everything was fine. And then they gave us the new user interface.. When I want to scroll trough playlists now, its 1 at a time, instead of a screen full of suggestions. It's useless! I don't want to scroll endlessly, I want to see the suggestions in a useful way, and I don't need video for that. I hope they give us the possibility to switch back to the old layout soon!

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Utter Disappointment... This app was very nice earlier, but with the latest update, it has got worse. Basic features like adding song to queue, revinding or forwarding song, or just even replaying from the beginning also require the Premium now. They haven't left any good features for the free users. YouTube is far better than this for music, the only problem is that it doesn't have the feature to listen to music with screen off. I am deleting this app. Doesn't deserve even one star now ðŸ˜”

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I honestly love Spotify, and it has been my go-to music platform. However, I encountered an unexpected issue recently. For some inexplicable reason, I was logged out of my account. I attempted to log in via the web page, but to my frustration, I couldn't play any music without the app. This is particularly inconvenient since I have a Spotify Premium subscription, and I expected an uninterrupted experience. Even on the web app, I noticed that ads were still appearing. Hope this is fixed.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: As a long-time Spotify user, I have to say that the latest update has left me quite disappointed. I sorely miss the "Up Next" queue feature, which used to help me organize and manage my music playback efficiently. The new "Smart Shuffle" feature isn't as smart as it claims to be. It often repeats songs or plays from the same artist or album, making the shuffle experience less random and enjoyable. The removal of key features like the queue and the accessible repeat button is a step backward.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Premium account. Android Auto. It is a real disaster for the driver: 1. If you have no display like in tesla, the buttons are too small. 2. Buttons are not always in the same place. I think mainly about "+" that will add the song to liked songs. It is really annoying while diving. 3. Search results - a few first songs are relevant, but later, they play something different. 4. Safety doesn't permit lyrics in Auto mode, but no problem if you crash while trying to find options in the messy menu.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I loved Spotify due to its unique features for the non-subscribers as well. I do not use subscription most if the time. Ads are tolerable. The new features is totally awful. Not able to listen the songs from the middle. Not able to listen music after a certain amount of time. It seems that Spotify is forcing people to pay and subscribe. People like us who do not wants subscription will obviously uninstall and choose some other apps over this. I am truly disappointed with Spotify.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: As a music lover I can approve that this app "was" the best app for listening to music. I have been using this app for the last 2-3 years. It has changed some of the basic features like shuffle play,tapping back,and reapeating songs as premium features. They might have did this to earn more profit.But it is not good at all. It is not fair for the people to pay for the basic features like this. If this problem is not being solved we will find some other app to listen to music.Don't install it.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
column3: It has a lot of great features for discovering songs and making playlists. I don't like the new explore shuffle option. It keeps causing delays when I'm trying to turn off shuffle. Also, the new home page is difficult to navigate. Edit: they did improve on the shuffle function to take dramatically less time to load in and is easier to tap past now.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: The push towards a worse UI has been baffling. Every update the app seems to lose usability and stability. Please bring back favorited songs, there was never a reason to get rid of that feature. The pop-up notifications when you add a song to a playlist are also completely broken. If you're going to charge more for a service, it should be improving, not deteriorating.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: I REALLY don't like that the heart has been removed fully in this most recent update. I rely heavily on the hearts being next to songs. I can go to any album or playlist and easily see what my favorite songs are. Now I have to go through multiple steps to figure it out, even having to flip back and forth between two pages to cross reference when I never had to before. And the simplicity of being able to like any song in just one click without having to be actively playing it is lost. Bad change.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Like Button Issues; Adding songs is the same in the new update, but un-adding is NOT. You have to click the checkmark to open playlists, uncheck liked songs, and click done. It went from one tap to three taps, including an extra menu. Seriously, how in the world am I supposed to do that while driving? You made things more difficult for absolutely no reason. You marketed it as the same experience with an extra feature, but in reality, it is NOT the same experience. Absolutely terrible change.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Was one of my most favorite app to listen the songs on, but by removing the most important and basic feature of a music, to listen to songs in my preference, adding songs to the queue and all was removed. This is such a basic feature, that shouldn't be removed but well. Had a great experience, but now due to this, I would need to switch over to another app.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Spotify has been turning into the worst music app ever. Like almost all features are premium as of now. Like they have made these things as premium play previous song, play in order, repeat song, and go into the middle of the song, and we can just play 6 songs a day that too whichever they suggest not which we want to. Also, a lot of songs almost 90% of the songs are showing that they can't find lyrics. Like seriously the basic rights of a music app??

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm using Spotify for 3-4 years. It was my favourite music listening app. But after the recent update I noticed that even the basic features they have restricted for premium users. Non-prime users can't listen to a certain part of a song, even the 10 seconds back or forward feature is also removed, can't shuffle the songs of any playlist, can't replay a song we have to go to the list and replay it. Anyhow ads every now and then were manageable but these types of features are really unacceptable.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: Did the history button on the home page go away with the latest update? Why take away useful features?! There's not even anything in it's place. Also, smart shuffle NEEDS to be a setting that can be turned off. It is a painful feature where it is now and is not seamless whatsoever. Move it or give the option to shut it off. Newest feature to the list of broken things in the app: scrolling on the home page doesn't work. It just pops you back up to the top of the home page. Great feature.

column2: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
column3: It's a nice app for music, it has more than enough songs available. Something that has ticked me, as a non-premium user, off a lot is, that after one of the recent updates, I can't play the song preview anymore in the playlist. Same goes for albums and similar things. Before, I was able to tap on the songs underneath to hear what the playlist contained. Now I can't anymore. I know it works just fine on premium. Reducing non-premium features more and more is something I'd call just kinda greedy.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been a premium user since past 2 years. I love the app. Tho, the recent changes in the free tier, just trash. Looping, skipping etc. are just basic features on any music streaming app. You cannot monetize them, or you should have simply remove the free tier entirely, let them find a different platform. On the premium tier, the smart shuffle feature needs to be tweaked. On desktop app, its difficult to just activate the "Shuffle" feature.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I have been using Spotify for the past 5 years and my experience with it is great. The new feature of the app is restricting shuffle play along with lyrics being unavailable for most of the songs and everything has been shifted to premium. Some of us cannot afford it. Being an old user I do not want to change apps but if this goes on I might have to.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: I'm really disappointed with the new updates. This was a free platform to listen to our favourite songs, to reverse or to forward any songs if we want. After the new update I also couldn't able to see the lyrics anymore of most of the songs. I was using it for 5 years till today. But after the new features and updates, it has became the worst.... I suggest you to remove this and make Spotify like the previous one.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
column3: It has now turned into EA of music industry, really hate the fact that it doesn't allow basic functionality that of a music app. They are already selling ads as photos, videos and audios between songs and by locking the basic functionality makes it way to annoying to use. I understand they are here to make profits, but just going down the EA way is to dirty for a buisness. If I'm down to take ads with basic functionality just let me have it. I don't need your premium features.

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
column3: The recent change to the heart button has made using the app to discover new music significantly more difficult. You can no longer see what songs you've liked in an album or playlist. The plus icon turns into a check mark regardless of whether you've liked the song or added it to any one of your playlists. Please fully flesh out and consider new "features" before making the experience worse just for the sake of changing things. Will be exploring alternative services

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I can't believe it. It lost all the features of a music app. I never felt this much done with any other app. Worst ever.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

As a user the new behaviour seems much worse. Also seems it's not possible to reorder the current play queue on Android, nor delete duplicate tracks.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

I will look for an another music streaming app. @spotify if u don't want to lose your users please do everything like it was earlier.

column2: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

It's a frustrating experience, and I'm actively looking for a better alternative that respects its users' needs and enjoyment.

column2: Rated 4 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

column2: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

I can never listen to my downloaded music without internet, even though that's the whole point of downloading music for offline!!
